cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts and groups that describe how shared cultural identities, interests, and anxieties shape the formation and evolution of tales and urban legends.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Tales evolved over time to suit the interests and fears of different cultures and their distinct cultural groups.

members.entity_description: Culturally specific anxieties that influence the content of tales and legends.
Distinct cultural groups whose shared interests and fears shape urban legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Macro-level social and cultural environments that shape the circulation and reception of phenomena such as urban legends in the present era.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Mainstream cultural environment and contemporary social context where urban legends circulate.

members.entity_description: The mainstream cultural environment where widely shared stories, media, and phenomena such as urban legends circulate and influence discourse.
Contemporary social context in which urban legends are prevalent.

cluster_classes.class_description: Contemporary folklore forms that circulate in modern societies, including urban legends and related narrative traditions that blend fact and fiction and reflect current social anxieties.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: modern folklore explicitly includes urban legends as part of contemporary traditional stories and beliefs

members.entity_description: Narrative stories within modern folklore, often fictional, that spread socially through communities and communication technologies, blending fact and fiction and frequently reflecting societal fears and anxieties.
The contemporary body of traditional stories, beliefs, and tales, including urban legends, that circulate within modern societies.

remarks: This class has been fully decomposed into two more precise classes: 'Urban Legends' and 'Modern Folklore'. It currently has no members and can be considered for deprecation or archival.

splits.name: Urban Legends
splits.description: Narrative stories within modern folklore, often fictional, that spread socially through communities and communication technologies, blending fact and fiction and frequently reflecting societal fears and anxieties.

splits.name: Modern Folklore (General)
splits.description: The contemporary body of traditional stories, beliefs, and tales, including urban legends, that circulate within modern societies.

args.justification: ClsC_75f4cf54 currently bundles two distinct but related concepts—urban legends as a specific narrative form and modern folklore as a broader domain—so splitting yields cleaner, single-focus classes.
args.remark: Original 'Modern Folklore' class was a composite of the general domain and the specific sub-type 'urban legends'; it has now been split into two focused classes.

args.justification: ClsC_c5cf3150 captures sociocultural contexts (fears of different cultures, cultural groups) that shape tales and urban legends, so it belongs in the shared domain-level group for urban legends and modern folklore.

ClsC_bbd396a2 represents contemporary macro cultural environments (popular culture, modern society) where urban legends circulate, so it should share the same high-level group as other urban-legend-related classes.

args.new_description: Narrative stories within modern folklore, typically contemporary, that spread socially through communities and media, blend fact and fiction, and frequently reflect societal fears and anxieties.
args.justification: The new split class centered on entity 'urban legends' should be clearly labeled and grouped as the core narrative phenomenon within the broader urban-legend/modern-folklore domain.

args.new_description: The contemporary body of traditional stories, beliefs, and narrative practices—including but not limited to urban legends—that circulate within modern societies.
args.justification: The new split class centered on the broader concept of modern folklore should be positioned as the overarching contemporary folkloric domain that includes urban legends, within the same high-level group.

args.new_description: Legacy composite class that previously combined the broad domain of modern folklore with the specific sub-type of urban legends; now superseded by separate classes for each.
args.remark: This class has been fully decomposed into two more precise classes: 'Urban Legends' and 'Modern Folklore'. It currently has no members and can be considered for deprecation or archival.
args.justification: After splitting out dedicated classes for urban legends and modern folklore, the source class should be marked as a legacy composite in the same group so humans know it is transitional and can retire it.
